      • addMethod

        public MethodScope addMethod​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<Argument>> methodData)
                      throws IllegalDeclarationException,
                             IncompatibleTypeException,
                             TypeNotSupportedException
        Add a new method to the Global Scope.
        Parameters:
        methodData - A HashMap with the method's name as key and arguments as an ArrayList of Arguments.
        Returns:
        The newly created MethodScope.
        Throws:
        IllegalDeclarationException - Thrown if the declaration is illegal.
        IncompatibleTypeException - Thrown if the referenced variable's type's incompatible with newVar's
        TypeNotSupportedException - Thrown if the type of the variable is'nt dupported by s-Java.

      • containsMethod

        public boolean containsMethod​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> methodData)
                       throws IllegalOperationException
        Check if the given method already exists.
        Parameters:
        methodData - A HashMap with the method's name as key and arguments as an ArrayList of Strings.
        Returns:
        true of it does exist.
        Throws:
        IllegalOperationException - Thrown if the method does not exist.

      • getMethod

        public MethodScope getMethod​(java.lang.String methodName)
        Parameters:
        methodName - The name of the required method.
        Returns:
        The MethodScope corresponding the given name.
